content:
My former boss picked the right moment to sell his business a few years ago (a printing service)...and now he tours the Mediterranian sea as a sailing coach. We just launched the Backdrop-based site (graphic design is from an external freelancer).

You might be interested of it because we ported and use the entity registration module from Drupal (thank you @Joseph Flatt , its working like a breeze), here are a few links if you'd like to check out...

Event offer (unlimited number of course dates possible per node)
https://skippercyrill.ch/toerns

Course dates, including available places (last column)
https://skippercyrill.ch/termine

Places available (Greece, @klonos might know it;-)
https://skippercyrill.ch/termin/ausbildungs-und-ferientorn-griechenland

Fully booked event (no signup possible, but waiting list could be activated)
https://skippercyrill.ch/termin/ausbildungstorn-griechenland

Signup form (you might even send it, test event will be deleted soon, you won't be charged for THIS one;-)
https://skippercyrill.ch/node/132/register

Awesome-looking site! ...another good fit for https://backdropcms.org/showcase :wink: ...that island there should be Serifos. I've never been there ...but then again there are soooo many islands in Greece, and I've only been in 4-5 of them. ...even a lifetime wouldn't be enough to visit all of them :sweat_smile: ...and even if one has the time/money, there are so many beautiful places in the world that are also very nice destinations.

Serifos - Wikipedia
Serifos (Greek: Σέριφος, Latin: Seriphus, also Seriphos; Seriphos: Eth. Seriphios: Serpho) is a Greek island municipality in the Aegean Sea, located in the western Cyclades, south of Kythnos and northwest of Sifnos. It is part of the Milos regional unit. The area is 75.207 square kilometres (29.038 sq mi)[2] and the population was 1,420 at the 2011 census. It is located about 170 kilometres (92 nautical miles) ESE of the Athenian port of Piraeus.
...so I got curious, and I typed "how many islands in greece" in Google: Screen-Shot-2020-07-13-at-3.50.31-pm.png

More precise quotes from the internet:

Greece has many islands, with estimates ranging from somewhere around 1,200 to 6,000, depending on the minimum size to take into account. The number of inhabited islands is variously cited as between 166 and 227...

...

There are more than 6,000 Greek Islands but only around 230 are inhabited and about 80 have a population over 100. ...
...it feels like life IS backwards. It should be like Benjamin Button ...you should be born old, work hard, and retire at your 30s, with enough $$$ to tour the world :sweat_smile:
(sorry for hijacking this thread @mazze.ch :sweat_smile: )

The number of Greek islands reminds me of the number of Estonian islands: https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_islands_of_Estonia

List of islands of Estonia - Wikipedia
This is an incomplete list of islands of Estonia. There are 2355 islands in total.
There you go :slight_smile: ...as I said, not enough time in one's life.
:-) Website mentiones "Lavrion" as starting point. There's a rumour that @klones will organize the first BackdropEurope® there;-))

Meh, more likely to organize the first Aussie Backdrop (with @BWPanda (Peter) :wink: ) ...I spend 80-90% of the year in OZ and only come to Greece for holidays and to be with my family. ...that was pre-COVID though.
Lovely site. Love the color scheme. Calming. Well done.
